name: IDK You Yet
lyrics:
[Refrain]
How can you miss someone you've never met?
'Cause I need you now but I don't know you yet
But can you find me soon because I'm in my head?
Yeah, I need you now but I don't know you yet

[Chorus]
'Cause lately it's been hard
They're selling me for parts
And I don't wanna be modern art
But I only got half a heart
To give to you

[Verse]
How can you miss someone you've never seen?
Oh, tell me are your eyes brown, blue, or green?
And do you like it with sugar and cream?
Or do you take it straight, oh, just like me?

[Chorus]
Yeah, lately it's been hard
They're selling me for parts
And I don't wanna be modern art
But I only got half a heart
To give to you

[Bridge]
And I hope it's enough
Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh
Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh
Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh
Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh

[Refrain]
How can you miss someone you've never met?
'Cause I need you now but I don't know you yet
But can you find me soon because I'm in my head?
Yeah, I need you now but I don't know you yet

[Outro]
I need you now but I don't know you yet
I need you now but I don't know you yet
I need you now but I don't know you yet
I need you now but I don't know you yet
annotations:

 But I only got half a heart

name: Good Without
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
You nearly gave me a heart attack
When you said you're doin' well
Is it obvious you're all I had?
And the last year's been like hell
Guess I'm lonely thinkin' that you ain't moved on
And I'm sorry if I'm comin' off too strong
Never thought I'd see the shape of pain
Standin' in the front porch light
Is it obvious I'm not okay?
Never meant to start a fight
Guess I'm just a moment livin' in your past
But I never thought you'd forget me so fast

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm starin' at all these photographs
I guess the good things ain't meant to last
I gave you forever, you gave a month
I've never fallen for anyone
And now I'm looking at the ceilin'
Wonderin' just what you're feelin' now
If that's what love's about
Then I'm so good without

(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without
(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without

[Verse 2]
I know you probably won't relate
I heard you met somebody new
Don't need no pity for pity's sake
You just do what you gotta do
Is it normal for the pain to grow from fear?
Am I weak for thinkin', "I wish you were here"?

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm starin' at all these photographs
I guess the good things ain't meant to last
I gave you forever, you gave a month
I've never fallen for anyone
And now I'm looking at the ceilin'
Wonderin' just what you're feelin' now
If that's what love's about
Then I'm so good without

[Post-Chorus]
(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without
(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without
(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without
(Ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh-ohh) I'm so good without
(I'm so good without)

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm starin' at all these photographs
I guess the good things ain't meant to last
I gave you forever, you gave a month
I've never fallen for anyone
And now I'm looking at the ceilin'
Wonderin' just what you're feelin' now
If that's what love's about
Then I'm so good without
annotations: [('Guess I’m just a moment livin’ in your past', [['It feels like your a statue & people are walking past you without noticing you’re standing right there, this was such a big realisation & honestly really wasn’t the best feeling in the world but I guess you can’t always do something about it!']]), ('Is it normal for the pain to grow from fear?', [['This lyric is such an important part of the song, Because it really is the fear of being lonely, which is where a lot of the heart break CAN stem from. Learning this throughout the process was such a confusing time for me but it’s something we all go through']]), ('I heard you met somebody new', [['It’s literally the exact way you see it happen in the movies.. Your friends spot them together or you end of seeing a picture of them together, Well this was exactly my experience & it really hits home that they just don’t care anymore so why should you?']]), ('Then I’m so good without', [['This is the MAIN lyric of them all, the whole song is built around this one moment which is such an empowering part, it flips the whole song over & brings a sense of realisation & love for yourself.. because one day you wake up & all the good comes flooding back in and the pain is gone']]), ('And now I’m looking at the ceilin’', [['I would literally just lay in bed all the time & do exactly this.. So I really wanted this lyric in the chorus to show the process of what’s going on in that exact moment']]), ('I guess the good things ain’t meant to last', [['Everyone knows that saying ‘the good things never last’ & I think when I used this lyric I really wanted it to be a kind of brush off of the situation, a sort of joke to myself .. kind of like I was the fool, but there’s also a strength in it at the same time where I’m becoming more powerful with letting it go the more I tell myself ‘I guess the good things ain’t meant to last’']]), ('Never thought I’d see the shape of pain\n Standin’ in the front porch light', [['This lyric really represents the moment when my ex & I said goodbye.. & i would repetitively look at the front porch and just remind myself of that last goodbye, it was a pretty sad line to get in but i guess you got to say it all']]), ('And the last year’s been like hell', [['This was the year where I honestly had done a 360 into a whole new chapter, everything was new for me at the time as I had moved away from home, so I really wanted to get this in on verse 1 because it was such a big part of the heartbreak & another reason why it was so hard to get over it all']]), ('You nearly gave me a heart attack\n When you said you’re doin’ well', [['When I wrote this lyric it really was the first stage for me in my heartbreak so I wanted it right at the beginning.. accepting that my ex was okay with not being with me anymore really was the hardest part. I guess I was kind of jealous of how he managed it, so when I say ‘you nearly gave me a heart attack’ it really felt like my whole body was in shock.']])]

name: Falling
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I'm in my bed
And you're not here
And there's no one to blame but the drink in my wandering hands
Forget what I said
It's not what I meant
And I can't take it back, I can't unpack the baggage you left

[Chorus]
What am I now? What am I now?
What if I'm someone I don't want around?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'
What if I'm down? What if I'm out?
What if I'm someone you won't talk about?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'

[Verse 2]
You said you cared, and you missed me too
And I'm well aware I write too many songs about you
And the coffee's out at the Beachwood Cafe
And it kills me 'cause I know we've run out of things we can say

[Chorus]
What am I now? What am I now?
What if I'm someone I don't want around?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'
What if I'm down? What if I'm out?
What if I'm someone you won't talk about?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'

[Bridge]
And I get the feeling that you'll never need me again

[Chorus]
What am I now? What am I now?
What if you're someone I just want around?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'
What if I'm down? What if I'm out?
What if I'm someone you won't talk about?
I'm falling again, I'm falling again, I'm fallin'
annotations:
[('What am I now? What am I now?', [['Zane Lowe finished his interview by asking Styles – “What do you think you were saying in that song listening back to it now?”

The chorus says like “What am I now? Am I someone I don’t want around?” – it was a big moment where I was kind of asking myself – “What am I doing?” I kind of started to feel threads of where I could see myself becoming someone that I didn’t want to be.']]), ('And there’s no one to blame but the drink in my wandering hands', [['Resorting in alcohol to try to ease the pain is reminiscent of “From the Dining Table”:

Fell back to sleep, I got drunk by noon
I’ve never felt less cool']]), ('Forget what I said
 It’s not what I meant', [['Miscommunication problems and lack of interaction are quite common in Harry’s songs. They’re present in his May 2017 debut record, Harry Styles, many times, such as in “Meet Me in the Hallway”:

We don’t talk about it, it’s something we don’t do

Additionally, in “Two Ghosts”:

Tongue-tied like we’ve never known
Telling those stories we already told
‘Cause we don’t say what we really mean

And finally, in “From the Dining Table”, the closure track, as well:

We haven’t spoke since you went away
Comfortable silence is so overrated
Why won’t you ever say what you want to say?']]), ('I’m in my bed
 And you’re not here', [["Loneliness is something that Harry has been writing about since early days, especially the particular feeling of waking up on his own, after having reached a point of closeness in a couple in which the two share a bed.

This worry was first seen in the unreleased “Don’t Let Me Go”, in which he has co-writing credits and it’s supposed to be from 2011/2012. The song also could be addressed to a partner to who Harry was very devoted and dependent, similar as here in “Falling”:

Don’t let me go
Cause I’m tired of sleeping alone

The motif continues in another unreleased track, “Half the World Away”. The demo was leaked onto YouTube on August 2020, but it’s rumored to be from 2013, close to the release of One Direction’s album “Take Me Home”.

I’m going to sleep alone tonight
Never gonna be the same, ‘cause you’re half the world away

Years later, now in Styles' debut album, it appears again in “From the Dining Table”:

Woke up alone in this hotel room"]]), ('And I get the feeling that you’ll never need me again', [['During the writing process for Fine Line, Harry and his then-girlfriend Camille Rowe parted ways after dating for a year. Producer Kid Harpoon revealed that the break-up took its toll on Harry, and his emotions made their way into his songwriting:

 He had a whole emotional journey about her, this whole relationship. But I kept saying, ‘The best way of dealing with it is to put it in these songs you’re writing.’

This idea is discussed in album-mate “Golden”, where he recalls the early stages of a relationship:

But I can feel it take a hold (I can feel it take a hold)
I can feel you take control (I can feel you take control)
Of who I am, and all I’ve ever known

This theme of dependency is also present several other tracks from Fine Line, including “Watermelon Sugar”:

I don’t know if I could ever go without

“Sunflower Vol. 6”:

Sunflower, my eyes want you more than a melody
Let me inside, wish I could get to know you']]), ('And the coffee’s out at the Beachwood Cafe', [['Beachwood Cafe is an American cafe, located in Los Angeles. During the writing process for Fine Line, Harry spent most of his time in Los Angeles, and was even spotted at the cafe on October 20, 2018.

Harry’s ex, French-American model Camille Rowe, was also a fan of the venue, revealing in a September 2018 interview that a visit to Beachwood Cafe would be included in her “ideal day in L.A.”:

I’d wake up with the sun and walk down to Beachwood Café for some eggs and toast, and then have friends come over to my house to swim. I’d read in the sun, cook dinner with my boyfriend, and watch the Sopranos.

Several other connections to Camille have been made on Fine Line, with her voice even featured on the album’s prior track “Cherry”, in a voicemail recorded in French.']])]

name: Is It Just Me? (feat. JP Cooper)
lyrics:
[Verse 1: Emily Burns]
It's been way too long for me to find it this hard
Sitting alone my fingers picking the sofa apart
An attempt to distract from the fact that I miss you
I wonder if your friends have had to carry you home
And stay for the night because
They don't want to leave you alone
Way before it was fun, it's becoming an issue

[Pre-Chorus: Emily Burns]

[Chorus: Emily Burns]

At the party when my name drops

Or is it just me?

When I say that we broke up and they ask why

Since I walked away and we left it so sour, I know

Please understand

That I know it's cruel

[Chorus: JP Cooper & Emily Burns, Emily Burns]
Tell me does your heart stop
At the party when my name drops

When the trains cross
Are you hurting? Yeah, you must be
Or is it just me?
Tongue-tied, screaming on the inside
When I say that we broke up and they ask why

Or is it just me?

[Bridge: JP Cooper & Emily Burns]
(Ah, ah, ah)
'Cause this would be one whole lot easier (Ah, ah, ah)
God, I know that's selfish but it's true (Ah, ah, ah)
If underneath some calm exterior
You're all fucked up too

[Chorus: Emily Burns, Emily Burns & JP Cooper, JP Cooper]
Tell me does your heart stop
At the party when my name drops
Like you're stood at the platform
When the trains cross
Are you hurting? Yeah, you must be
Or is it just me?
Tongue-tied, screaming on the inside
When I say that we broke up and they ask why
Are you crying in the shower like a freak?
With only cigarettes for company?

Or is it just me?
annotations:

So as far as we are concerned they either broke up because they were both unhappy, or another ended the relationship as they were hurting the other. So when she asks how he’s feeling she almost wants reassurance that after the end of the relationship, he is suffering as she is.
When Copper sings he talks about how their relationship turned sour, which suggests that they ended their relationship because it was toxic. So, as they both hurt each other in and after their relationship they are hopping that they suffer so they don’t feel guilty or ashamed for what they have done']]), ('Like you’re stood at the platform
 When the trains cross', [['When trains rush past you at a platform they go by so quickly sometimes that it can feel like your heart skips a beat – which is what she is saying here. Bitterly, she is hoping that whenever he hears her name his stomach sinks(or he feels a pang in his heart) because he feels upset by the fact that they have broken up or even guilty if he’s hurt her']]), ('I know it’s cruel
 But I kind of hope you’re tortured too', [['Throughout the song it is suggested that the relationship has ended, but neither party wanted it to end – although it seemed like a toxic relationship. So although she is missing her ex she is wishing that they are feeling just as much pain as she is, to either even out the pain which she feels or make up for the actions that he did to end the relationship']])]

but here he wanna undo all things so thats what makes him a train wreck and he needs to be pulled out']]), ('I’m not ready to die, not yet', [['Arthur has stated that he used to have panic attacks so intense that he would feel as though he is dying and call an ambulance, despite the amount of mental and physical suffering he has endured, events such as these allowed him to come to the realisation that he does not want to die and is willing to work through the pain.']]), ('Unburn the ashes
 Unchain the reactions now', [['The idea of “unburn[ing] the ashes” is reminiscent of the concept of phoenix. Phoenixes are mythical birds which lived for centuries at a time; they burned themselves and were reborn from their ashes, youthful and able to continue their life cycle again. This concept can be applied to James making his comeback from ‘burning himself out’ due to his mental illnesses.

The line “unchain the reactions” plays on a chemical chain reaction; a self-sustaining reaction. This concept can be applied to any self-destructive behaviours James may have acquired and become dependent upon during his struggle. By “unchain[ing]” them, this could mean that James wants to free himself from this vicious cycle and move on.']]), ('Laying in the silence
 Waiting for the sirens
 Signs, any signs I’m alive still
 I don’t wanna lose it
 But I’m not getting through this
 Hey, should I pray
 Should I pray, yeah, to myself
 To a God? To a saviour who can', [['James has openly spoken about his battles with depression and anxiety, leading to panic attacks. In an interview with The Mirror, James recalls that “his panic attacks became so bad that he would call for an ambulance out of fear he was suffering a heart attack”. It’s clear to see that James was in a bad place, and wasn’t sure if he would be able to get past his mental health issues.']])]

name: drivers license
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I got my driver's license last week
Just like we always talked about
'Cause you were so excited for me
To finally drive up to your house
But today I drove through the suburbs
Crying 'cause you weren't around

[Verse 2]
And you're probably with that blonde girl
Who always made me doubt
She's so much older than me
She's everything I'm insecure about
Yeah, today I drove through the suburbs
'Cause how could I ever love someone else?

[Chorus]
And I know we weren't perfect
But I've never felt this way for no one
And I just can't imagine
How you could be so okay now that I'm gone
Guess you didn't mean what you wrote in that song about me
'Cause you said forever, now I drive alone past your street

[Verse 3]
And all my friends are tired
Of hearing how much I miss you, but
I kinda feel sorry for them
'Cause they'll never know you the way that I do
Yeah, today I drove through the suburbs
And pictured I was driving home to you

[Chorus]
And I know we weren't perfect
But I've never felt this way for no one, oh
And I just can't imagine
How you could be so okay now that I'm gone
I guess you didn't mean what you wrote in that song about me
'Cause you said forever, now I drive alone past your street

[Bridge]
Red lights, stop signs
I still see your face in the white cars, front yards
Can't drive past the places we used to go to
'Cause I still fuckin' love you, babe (Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh)
Sidewalks we crossed
I still hear your voice in the traffic, we're laughing
Over all the noise
God, I'm so blue, know we're through
But I still fuckin' love you, babe (Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh)

[Chorus]
I know we weren't perfect
But I've never felt this way for no one
And I just can't imagine
How you could be so okay now that I'm gone
Guess you didn't mean what you wrote in that song about me
'Cause you said forever, now I drive alone past your street

[Outro]
Yeah, you said forever, now I drive alone past your street
annotations:
[('‘Cause I still fuckin’ love you, babe (Ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh)', [['The use of profanity emphasizes Olivia’s internal chaos from within her feelings that otherwise would not have been able to be expressed in some other way. It helps establish a mood of anger and despair.

Olivia talked about writing this line with producer Dan Nigro in The New York Times series, “Diary of a Song”:

Dan was like, “What if we say, ‘I still fuckin’ love you,‘” and I’m like, “That’s brilliant. Let’s do it.” I think it’s actually really cool that I did swear in my first song. I guess it’s a nice, like, “Ah, look, I’m an adult. I can say—” I’m not an adult, I’m seventeen, haha.

In the clean version of the song, and in certain live performances, this line is changed to:

[‘Cause / But] you know I still love you, babe']]), ('Red lights, stop signs', [['In keeping with the ideology of driving through the song; Rodrigo points to two symbols of stopping: traffic lights and stop signs. The symbolism refers to the end of the relationship with her lover.

This lyric was posted to Rodrigo’s Instagram page accompanied by a red picture of her, keeping in line with the lyrics.



This line is the first of three colored lyrics in the bridge, the other two colors being white and blue.']]), ('Just like we always talked about
 ’Cause you were so excited for me', [['Joshua Bassett, who the song is rumored to be about, helped teach Olivia how to drive. In an Instagram Story from January 2020, Olivia talked about getting her first driving experience with Joshua, after they learned that the song they wrote together, “Just for a Moment.” would be used in High School Musical: The Musical: The Series:

We celebrated and we went to In-N-Out, and I couldn’t drive actually. I was sixteen, but I didn’t have my permit, and so he took me in his car, and we drove around the In-N-Out parking lot. That was my first time driving, so I’ll always remember that.

Olivia has also referenced driving on her unreleased track “Gross”:

And driving in your car, I feel all grown up']]), ('God, I’m so blue, know we’re through', [['“Feeling blue” is a phrase meaning to feel depressed or disappointed. The color blue is often associated with being sad, with a genre of music even being named after these emotions.

The music video for “drivers license” contains darker colors, tinting Olivia’s skin tone. In scenes within the video, she is cast in a blue shade. This is a clever nod to this line, as well as a unique rendering of her emotions throughout the song.']]), ('I got my driver’s license last week', [["Olivia Rodrigo is based in California, USA. According to the California Driver Handbook, a Minors' Driver License has the following requirements:


Be at least 16 years old;
Proof of completion of both driver education and driver training;
Parent(s) or guardian(s) signature(s) on an instruction permit certifying the completion of 50 hours of supervised driving practice (10 hours must be night driving)





Olivia wrote the song in the summer of 2020 when she was 17, lining up with the age requirement for an actual Californian driver’s license.

The image of passing a driving test as a rite of passage into adulthood also fits in with the song’s theme of growing up through a painful experience."]]), ('I still see your face in the white cars, front yards', [['This line further points towards the song being about Joshua Bassett. As we know from Joshua’s YouTube channel, he does in fact drive a white Honda.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-c2o6wSLblk

Furthermore, on January 4th, 2020, Bassett teased his then-upcoming song “Lie Lie Lie” on Instagram, and posted a picture of him and a blonde-haired girl in a dimly lit car, linking back to the second verse where Rodrigo sings “and you’re probably with that blonde girl.” Similarly, in Rodrigo’s “drivers license” video, she can also be seen in a dimly lit car.']]), ('Guess you didn’t mean what you wrote in that song about me', [['This could be a reference to Joshua Bassett’s July 2020 song “Anyone Else.” He stated that he wrote this song in the Salt Lake City apartment he lived in while filming season one of High School Musical: The Musical: The Series, after realizing that he was “hopelessly falling in love with a close friend… who was in a relationship.”

Since the production of the show began back in early 2019, Bassett could’ve been referencing Rodrigo’s then-relationship with Ethan Wacker, her former Bizaardvark co-star.

This line differs from the original version of the song teased on Instagram on July 23, 2020, in which Rodrigo sings:

And I don’t believe you when you say I did nothing wrong']]), ('[Verse 1]', [['The track features sound of a car door opening, keys jangling, and the car beeping. In a YouTube live stream before the release of the song, Olivia explained the sounds she used:

I wanted to incorporate car sounds into it so I made my mom record her car in our driveway. There’s little car sounds in the song, which I think is super fun.

The beep soon transforms into part of the song’s backing track, perhaps mirroring Rodrigo’s transformation of her experiences with driving into a musical expression of her heartbreak. The intro places the listener in the driver’s seat, effectively evoking the experience of a lonely, tear-filled drive at night.']]), ('And all my friends are tired
 Of hearing how much I miss you, but', [['Olivia said on an Instagram Live (at about 29:45) the night the song came out that this line was especially about her former Bizaardvark co-star Madison Hu. She said she talked to Madison about all of her problems and Madison was more of the neutral one in the situation.']]), ('And you’re probably with that blonde girl
 Who always made me doubt
 She’s so much older than me
 She’s everything I’m insecure about', [['It’s rumored that Olivia and her co-star on High School Musical: The Musical: The Series, Joshua Bassett, began dating while filming the show in 2019, and called it quits in early 2020.

In June 2020, Joshua and singer/actress Sabrina Carpenter were spotted together at a protest, sparking rumors that the two of them were dating. Olivia posted the demo version of the song on her Instagram the following month.

Sabrina has blonde hair and is four years older than Olivia. However, in the original lyrics, Olivia referred to the girl as brunette rather than blonde. While Olivia has stated that some lyrics were changed at the recommendation of the song’s producer, Dan Nigro, the reason for that specific change has not been confirmed. There are multiple theories as to why, including “blonde” having less syllables than “brunette,” thus improving the lyrical flow; to emphasize how different the girl is from Olivia, who is a brunette herself; or that Olivia was being intentionally cryptic with the original lyrics.']])]

name: Happiest Year
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I'm really on the ropes this time
I've been fighting all my life for you
I never should've said goodbye
But maybe that's what stupid people do

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cause you gave me peace
And I wasted it
I'm here to admit
That you were my medicine
Oh, I couldn't quit
And I'm down on my knees again
Asking for nothing

[Chorus]
Thank you for the happiest year of my life
Thank you for the happiest year of my life, ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh

[Verse 2]
Don't think I could forgive myself
I'm sorry for the ways that I used you
And I could care less right now
But you know, you hurt me pretty good too

[Pre-Chorus]
Yeah, we made each other bleed
And we tasted it
I'm here to admit
That you were my medicine
Oh, love, I couldn't quit
And I'm down on my knees again

[Chorus]
Thank you for the happiest year of my life
Oh, thank you for the happiest year of my life, ooh

[Verse 3]
So wake me up when they build that time machine
I want to go back
Wake me up when you were sleeping next to me
'Cause I really loved you, ooh

[Chorus]
Thank you for the happiest year of my life
Thank you for the happiest year of my life ooh
Thank you for the happiest year of my life, yeah
Thank you for the happiest year of my life
Thank you for the happiest year of my life

name: we'll be fine
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I wish we could cut all ties with the morning light
Because our secret’s in the dark
And though I don’t take it to heart
I just need more time
To appreciate what we’ll leave behind
Like the feeling when you’re holding me still with your eyes
It’s as real as the stars that freckle the sky

[Pre-Chorus]
But how long will we fall
For how long will we fall
Before we can climb?

And will this get too hard
Will we even get far
Will our words suffice?

[Chorus]
I wanna know what it’s like
Let’s just erase all the downsides
If not forever then just for tonight
Give me all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine

We’ll be fine
We’ll be fine

[Verse 2]
And all of the light we’re missing
Thanks to the sun’s indifference
Oh limited time is hard to survive
With no sacrifice

But conversation’s flowing
Further than every ocean
Oh please tell me why
Please tell me why
This feels so right

[Pre-Chorus]
But how long will we fall
For how long will we fall
Before we can climb?

And will this get too hard
Will we even get far
Will our words suffice?

[Chorus]
I wanna know what it’s like
Let’s just erase all the downsides
If not forever then just for tonight
Give me all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine

Oh there’s no need to clarify
I know I’ll have your heart in time
It’s just so hard when you’re all I desire
I just want all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine

[Bridge]
We’ll be fine
We’ll be fine
We’ll be fine

[Chorus]
I wanna know what it’s like
Lets just erase all the downsides
If not forever then just for tonight
Give me all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine

Oh there’s no need to clarify
I know I’ll have your heart in time
It’s just so hard when you’re all I desire
I just want all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine, we’ll be fine

[Outro]
I just want all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine
We’ll be fine
I just want all of you
Trust me, I know that we’ll be fine

name: Heather
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I still remember, third of December, me in your sweater
You said it looked better on me than it did you
Only if you knew, how much I liked you
But I watch your eyes as she

[Pre-Chorus]
Walks by
What a sight for sore eyes, brighter than a blue sky
She's got you mesmerized while I die

[Chorus]
Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it's just polyester
But you like her better
(Wish I were Heather)

[Verse 2]
Watch as she stands with her, holding your hand
Put your arm 'round her shoulder, now I'm getting colder
But how could I hate her? She's such an angel
But then again, kinda wish she were dead as she

[Pre-Chorus]
Walks by
What a sight for sore eyes, brighter than a blue sky
She's got you mesmerized while I die

[Chorus]
Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it's just polyester
But you like her better
(I wish I were Heather)

[Bridge]
(Oh) Wish I were Heather
(Oh, oh) Wish I were Heather

[Chorus]
Why would you ever kiss me?
I'm not even half as pretty
You gave her your sweater, it's just polyester
But you like her better
Wish I were
annotations:
[('You gave her your sweater, it’s just polyester', [['Conan feels resentful because his crush gave Heather the sweater that he wore on the third of December.  He tries to reason with himself saying it’s just polyester.']]), ('You gave her your sweater, it’s just polyester', [['Conan feels resentful because his crush gave Heather the sweater that he wore on the third of December.  (Oh, oh) Wish I were Heather', [['Gray would do anything for his crush to love him. He thinks about becoming Heather because he wants to be someone his crush likes.

From billboard’s article on Conan Gray and the ‘Heather’ music video, Gray said in a press statement:

Heather was gentle and beautiful, inside and out. She was warm like a summer day, and had so many friends. She was soft and so easily lovable— everything I am not. The ‘Heather’ video is my way of becoming all of the things that I envy about Heather. I would’ve done anything to be like her. Wear the right pretty clothes and act the right effortless way. Reject all the things that made me who I am. Anything to be loved back by the person I loved. Anything to be their first choice. The slow transformation throughout the video was made to represent the feminine and masculine traits I constantly switched between in order to become who I knew my crush would like. name: Arms Around You
lyrics:
Verse 1
I wanna know when you first felt alone next to me
Only now do I understand the reason that you had to leave
Oh I didn't see the signs or read between the lines
Now it’s obvious the things I should have said
Should have looked you in the eye, give you more of my time
But I was selfish, now I see what you meant

Chorus
So I wish that I held you, I do
I guess I got complacent
Now I'm alone just blaming myself
If I knew that you needed me too
I would have never let go
Would have held you so close
Put my arms around you
Put my arms around you

Verse 2
I wanna know when you first knew that you had to go
It's been so long since our last kiss, I think back I should have known
Oh I didn’t see the signs or read between the lines
Now it's obvious the things I should have said
Should have looked you in the eye, give you more of my time
But I was selfish, now I see what you meant

Chorus
So I wish that I held you, I do
I guess I got complacent
Now I'm alone just blaming myself
If I knew that you needed me too
I would have never let go
Would have held you so close
Put my arms around you
Put my arms around you

Bridge
I don't know how this happened to me
How I didn't see what we had
No, I won't forgive myself
When I'll know you're not coming back

Chorus
So I wish that I held you, I do
I guess I got complacent
Now I’m alone just blaming myself
If I knew that you needed me too
I would have never let go
Would have held you so close
Put my arms around you
Put my arms around you
Put my arms around you

name: Conversations in the Dark
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Talk, let's have conversations in the dark
World is sleeping, I'm awake with you, with you
Watch movies that we've both already seen
I ain't even looking at the screen
It's true, I got my eyes on you

[Pre-Chorus]
And you say that you're not worthy
You get hung up on your flaws
Well, in my eyes, you are perfect as you are

[Chorus]
I won't ever try to change you, change you
I will always want the same you, same you
Swear on everything I pray to
That I won't break your heart
I'll be there when you get lonely, lonely
Keep the secrets that you told me, told me
And your love is all you owe me
And I won't break your heart

[Verse 2]
On Sunday mornings we sleep in 'til noon
Oh, I could sleep forever next to you, next to you
And we, we got places we both gotta be
But there ain't nothing I would rather do
Than blow off all my plans for you

[Pre-Chorus]
And you say that you're not worthy
And get hung up on your flaws
But in my eyes, you are perfect as you are
As you are

[Chorus]
I won't ever try to change you, change you
I will always want the same you, same you
Swear on everything I pray to
That I won't break your heart
I'll be there when you get lonely, lonely
Keep the secrets that you told me, told me
And your love is all you owe me
And I won't break your heart

[Bridge]
When no one seems to notice
And your days, they seem so hard
My darling, you should know this
My love is everywhere you are

[Chorus]
I won't ever try to change you, change you (Yeah)
I will always want the same you, same you (Oh-oh)
Swear on everything I pray to
That I won't break your heart (Yeah)
I'll be there when you get lonely, lonely (Oh, when you get lonely)
Keep the secrets that you told me, told me (Yeah-yeah)
And your love is all you owe me
And I won't break your heart

[Outro]
Ooh
Ooh
I won't break your heart

name: Learn To Let Go
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Find your feet
Don't look down
'Cos we've come a little far just to give it up
But I kinda feel like we've given up now
We can't climb
If we're intertwined
Oh, I never would have thought we were holding on
For too long

[Chorus]
It's alright
Release the pressure
Don't hold tight
We need to learn to let go
Let go

[Verse 2]
Trust these words
Though I get a little tongue-tied sometimes
We're worth
More than I ever could know

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cos we've come a little far just to give it up
But I kinda feel like we've given up now

[Chorus]
It's alright
Release the pressure
Don't hold tight
We need to learn to let go
Let go

[Bridge]
And you might just say that you love me
But it kills me that we can't breathe
And you might just say you love me
But it kills me 'cos we can't see

And you might just say you love me
But it kills me that we can't breathe
And you might just say you love me
Like the first time and now I leave

And you might just say you love me
But it kills me that we can't breathe
And you might just say you love me again

[Chorus]
It's alright
Release the pressure
Don't hold tight
We need to learn to let go
Let go
Learn to let go
Let go

name: What They'll Say About Us
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
You're tired now, lie down
I'll be waitin' to give you the good news
It might take patience
And when you wake up, it won't be over
So don't you give up

[Chorus]
We've got the time to take the world
And make it better than it ever was
That's what they'll say about us

[Verse 2]
If I say a cliché, it's 'cause I mean it
We can't walk away, we gotta get in between it
And when you wake up, we'll grow together
So don't you give up

[Chorus]
We've got the time to take the world
And make it better than it ever was
That's what they'll say about us

[Bridge]
I never said it would be easy
I'm never giving up, believe me
I used to think the pain would fade, but it never does

[Outro]
You're tired now, lie down
I'll be waitin' to give you the good news
It might take patience
And if you don't wake up
I'll know you tried to
I wish you could see him
He looks just like you

name: Unconditional
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
You call me up the fall apart
And then she says that it's not enough
Make a mess and brush it up
But honey, I guess I am not so tough
I'm all alone, stay on the phone, I'm
So far away but now I'm home
You call me up to fall apart
'Cause I promise it will be enough

[Pre-Chorus]
All in time, give me time
I've been drowning for the both of us

[Chorus]
We can grow, we're not broken
Keep close, keep me hoping
You and I were unconditional
My love, my love
You and I were unconditional
Our love’s enough

[Post-Chorus]
'Cause I've lost my way
Can you say my name?

[Verse 2]
Been a while, so much to say
I've been staying out and drinking late
'Cause it'll all be worth the wait
But tomorrow seems so far away
I think of you, I'm lying up
You're restless too, we're out of touch
Been a while, so much to say
But I know that it'll be okay

[Pre-Chorus]
All in time, give me time
I've been drowning for the both of us

[Chorus]
We can grow, we're not broken
Keep close, keep me hoping
You and I were unconditional
My love, my love
You and I were unconditional
Our love’s enough

[Post-Chorus]
'Cause I've lost my way
Can you say my name?
We'll bend, not break
When you say my name
Morning, it feels so far away

[Chorus]
We can grow, we're not broken
Keep close, keep me hoping
You and I were unconditional
My love, my love
You and I were unconditional
Our love’s enough

name: Haunted House
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
They say this house is haunted
But all these ghosts I've grown with
As it slips away from me
I still hold on hopelessly
I lay my head to sleep and say goodnight

[Verse 2]
Bringing up four daughters
Made the house a fortress
Dirty knees and honey bees
And nowhere else would sting as sweet
Can't believe we're turning off the lights

[Verse 3]
And one day I'll drive past you
If I recognise you
I'll try not to stay too long
See the soil I grew upon
In a couple years I'll be alright

[Outro]
So darling
Pull the curtains
And in the morning
Let me lie here with you
Don't say that I'm lеaving
In the morning
Let me liе here with you

name: Break My Heart - Piano Acoustic
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Oh, loving you, it kills my courage
Oh, loving you, it takes my pride, hey
And oh, wish I knew a way to cut this
Make it the last time, for the last time

[Pre-Chorus]
'Cause you've ruined the city for me, it only took one night
And yeah, I keep coming back and you know the reason why
You've ruined the city for me, so if you're gonna do it, do it right

[Chorus]
If you're gonna break my heart, then do it right
Don't you leave me hanging on like the last time
Break my heart, then do it right
'Cause it's gonna burn without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you
Without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you
Yeah

[Verse 2]
Crack my head upon the pavemеnt
Oh, and I'd still come back for more, yeah
You gotta lеave my heart vacant
Just paint the, the sign upon the door

[Pre-Chorus]
Hah, 'cause you've ruined the city for me, it only took one night
And yeah, I keep coming back and you know the reason why
You've ruined the city for me, so if you're gonna do it, do it right
And oh-oh

[Chorus]
If you're gonna break my heart, then do it right
Don't you leave me hanging on like the last time
Break my heart, then do it right
'Cause it's gonna burn without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you
Yeah, without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you

[Bridge]
Oh, you're so cold, cold-blooded
When you got a hold, there's no one could stop it
Oh, oh-oh, oh-oh, you're so cold, cold-blooded
When you got a hold, there's no one could stop it

[Chorus]
If you're gonna break my heart then do it right
Don't you leave me hanging on like the last time
Break my heart, then do it right
'Cause it's gonna burn without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you
Yeah, without you
Oh, oh-oh, without you
Without you

name: if this is the last time
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Hey, mom, I know we're gettin' old
And the lines on our hands have changed
But you still look at me the same
Hey, mom, guess what? You're really tough
And I know you did all you could
Just to make sure my life was good

[Pre-Chorus]
Sorry for the fights and the tone of my voice
Sorry for the nights when I made the wrong choice
Life is flyin' by and it's hittin' me now
I hope it's not, but

[Chorus]
If this is the last time, please come close
I love you with all my heart, you know
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time
Then let's do the things we always do
Like go to the mall and buy some shoes
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time

[Verse 2]
Hey, dad, what's up? Miss you so much
Yeah, the shade of your hair has changed
But I look up to you the same

[Pre-Chorus]
Taught me how to fish, taught me how to ride a bike
Taught me how to love, how to treat a woman right
Life is flyin' by and it's hittin' me now
I hope it's not, but

[Chorus]
If this is the last time, please come close
I love you with all my heart, you know
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time
Then let's do the things we always do
Like go for a drive or watch the news
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time

[Bridge]
Hey you, sit back
Don't go so fast

[Chorus]
If this is the last time, please come close
I love you with all my heart, you know
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time
So let's do the things we always do
Or maybe we try something brand new
I don't wanna cry, I'm bad at goodbye
If this is the last time

[Outro]
If this is the last time
If this is the last time
Oh, if this is the last time
If this is the last time
If this is the last time
Oh, if this is the last time

name: lie to me
lyrics:
[Verse 1: Tate McRae]
You don't understand, I'm not ever like this
I can hold my breath, say "I'll be alright"
But kinda hard to think
When I can't feel a thing
Tell me to my face already heard it last week
Driving me insane, it's hitting real badly
Tell me, what's her name? Yeah

[Chorus: Tate McRae]
Said you'd never, why'd you ever
Lie to me baby, lie, lie to me
Lie to me baby, lie, lie to me
Lie to me baby, lie, lie to me, yeah
Said you'd never, why'd you еver
Lie to me baby, liе, lie to me

lyrics:

All our fears would be irrelevant

[Pre-Chorus: JP Saxe]
I know, you know, we know you weren't
Down for forever and it's fine
I know, you know, we know we weren't
Meant for each other and it's fine

[Chorus: JP Saxe & Julia Michaels]
But if the world was ending, you'd come over, right?
You'd come over and you'd stay the night
Would you love me for the hell of it?
All our fears would be irrelevant
If the world was ending, you'd come over, right?

Hmm

annotations:
[('Ah, it’s been a year now, think I’ve figured out how
 How to think about you without it rippin’ my heart out', [['It takes a lot of effort not to hate somebody and not think about somebody or look at somebody and think, “Wow, you really impacted my life and you really broke my heart.” And to be able to get past that and look at somebody and be like, “Hey, we’re good now. I’m good, you’re good. We can shake hands and go our separate ways and feel content.”']]), ('But it really got me thinkin’, the night we went drinkin’
 Stumbled in the house and didn’t make it past the kitchen', [['I think it’s the same thing that even JP does best is we put things in a moment. We like to give somebody a visual of the scenario because then it helps them see it, and it’s relatable in the sense that anybody that’s been there, they can put themselves in it as well. So I’ve always written like that. I think when anything big happens in your life like an earthquake, for me, you go through the memories of things that you would change, things that you may have done differently if you had the chance. Then you start thinking about memories with that person, good and bad. So I guess that’s where it really comes from is if the world was ending, I know I would be thinking about those kinds of things. Things I could’ve done differently or memories that were my favorite memories of the person that I loved.']]), ('It didn’t scare me when the earthquake happened', [['I think it’s just because I’ve lived in LA almost my whole life, so earthquakes aren’t a big deal for me. It’s weird when you’re experiencing it when it’s happening because you start to think, “Oh, anything other than an earthquake is happening right now.” When the earthquake actually happened the second time, I was at a Shawn Mendes concert. We thought that people above us were just jumping around or dancing too much and it was making the thing shake. We were thinking of every scenario as to why we would be moving other than the fact that we were having another earthquake, and it was like, “Oh…” It was just a bit jarring more than it was scary.']]), ('I tried to imagine your reaction', [['I guess when anything impactful happens in your life, both good and bad, for me especially, I tend to think about what I would be doing had I been with a certain person or something bad happened, or, “Oh my gosh, I hope they’re okay.” Even if something had gone horribly wrong, I still have a heart.']]), ('If the world was ending, you’d come over, right? Right?
 If the world was ending, you’d come over, right? Right?', [['I feel like there’s a lot in that one word: “right.” There’s a lot in it. There’s the doubt, there’s the hope, there’s the, “Am I tripping? Are you with me on this?” There’s a lot said in that one “Right” that is the period of everything that’s happened before it.']]), ('If the world was ending, you’d come over, right?
 The sky’d be falling and I’d hold you tight', [['I think there’s two situations in the song. There’s the beginning situation, which is a very small, harmless earthquake. And then there’s the fantasy that exists in both of our heads of, well if everything did go to shit, what then goes down. So it isn’t a specific situation because it’s in our heads. So the earthquake looks like the sky falling. We’re not accurately depicting the geographical impact of such a thing. But we’re songwriters, we don’t understand that.']]), ('And there wouldn’t be a reason why
 We would even have to say goodbye', [['A lot of my favorite songwriting, it’s like articulates a feeling that you’ve absolutely had but you’ve never really put your finger on. I think that’s what Julia did with that lyric.']]), ('But if the world was ending, you’d come over, right?
 You’d come over and you’d stay the night', [['You can do whatever the fuck you want. You can make a bad decision if there is no consequences to those bad decisions. Not to get ahead of ourselves. But that’s why I think it was Julia who had that line at the end of the chorus. And there wouldn’t be a reason why we would even have to say goodbye, which stabbed me in the fucking heart when she first said it, because that feeling like, well, if we didn’t have to say goodbye to one another, this would be okay, but the reason you’re not saying goodbye to each other, is dark as hell. But there’s something about just that removal of all consequences by the universe.']]), ('I know, you know, we know you weren’t
 Down for forever and it’s fine
 I know, you know, we know we weren’t
 Meant for each other and it’s fine', [['I think it’s just the recognition that in a normal non-world ending scenario, both of you are on the same page about it not being something you should be in.   It’s not sarcastic. It’s a genuine, it’s totally fine. I’ve recognized that a difficult transition that we had in our lives was the correct thing to do. And we were both on the same page that it is fine that we are no longer together, and it’s fine that we don’t talk because that’s for both of us and our current life in a world that isn’t falling apart. But if the world was falling apart, maybe all that rationality would no longer apply.']]), ('It’s been a year now, think I’ve figured out how
 How to let you go and let communication die out', [['I think after a relationship you put a lot of work into figuring out how to not feel connected to a person anymore, and that’s not just something that fades away. It takes some work to not text them, to not look at the fucking photos. That takes some effort. That moment in the song is just imagining some catastrophic event that would circumvent all of that effort and all of a sudden a year of work is just like, well fuck, does it even matter anymore? I think the song is kind of about like a little bit fantasizing about there being some sort of situation which would make all of your very rational reasons not to talk to someone no longer relevant.']])]

name: Let Me Love You Like A Woman
lyrics:

I come from a small town, how 'bout you?
I only mention it 'cause I'm ready to leave LA
And I want you to come
Eighty miles north or south will do
I don't care where as long as you're with me

Let me hold you like a baby
Let me shine like a diamond
Let me be who I'm meant to be
Talk to me in poems and songs
Don't make me be bittersweet
Let me love you like a woman
Let me hold you like a baby
Let me hold you like a baby

[Verse 2]

I only mention it 'cause I'm ready to leave LA
And I want you to come (And I need you to come)
I guess I could manage if you stay
It's just if you do, I can't see myself having any fun, so

[Chorus]
Let me love you like a woman

Talk to me in songs and poems
Don't make me be bittersweet
Let me love you like a woman

[Post-Chorus]

Take you to infinity
Let me love you like a woman (Let me hold you like a baby)
Take you to infinity

[Bridge]
We could get lost in the purple rain
Talk about the good ol' days
We could get high on some pink champagne
Baby, let me count the ways

[Chorus]
Let me love you like a woman
Let me hold you like a baby
Let me shine like a diamond
Let me be who I'm meant to be
Talk to me in songs and poems
Don't make me be bittersweet
Let me love you like a woman
annotations:
[('We could get high on some pink champagne', [['“Pink champagne” is a nickname for a form of the drug MDMA. “Pink champagne” is also sometimes called “magic” or “Rolls Royce,” due to the effects it has on a person.

MDMA, which stands for 3,4-methylenedioxy-methamphetamine, is a psychedelic stimulant drug that can result in hallucinations and increase of extroversion. The drug is popularly used in clubs or raves to help one’s psyche match the energetic atmosphere.



 Image of “pink champagne”

Del Rey is not shy about mentioning substances in her discography – in fact, several of her tracks are named after drugs, including “Heroin” (2017), “Florida Kilos” (2014), and “Yayo” (2012).']]), ('I come from a small town, how ’bout you?
 I only mention it ’cause I’m ready to leave LA', [['Del Rey was raised in Lake Placid, a small village in the New York countryside that yielded a population of around 2,200 residents in 2018.

Del Rey very often alludes to the expansive New York City in her songs, but she first mentioned her hometown of Lake Placid in her August 2019 single “Looking For America”:

Took a train up to Lake Placid
That’s another place and time, where
I used to go to drive-ins and listen to the blues

Del Rey didn’t always have the greatest relationship with her hometown—she told NME in September 2012 that she left the city at age fourteen to attend an out-of-state boarding school after developing a drinking problem.

However, this line suggests a major disruption in Lana’s worldview. LA, ever an active character in her musical mythos for better or for worse, seems to have reached its final straw for her. The city’s hustle-and-bustle has mistreated her so badly that she begins to reminisce back to her childhood in Lake Placid.']]), ('We could get lost in the purple rain
 Talk about the good ol’ days', [['“Purple Rain” is a nod to Prince’s classic 1984 track, “Purple Rain.” The track draws imagery of a wistful relationship that, through its highs and lows, survives until the very end of time. “Let Me Love You Like a Woman” shares a similar sentiment, with Del Rey envisioning a future in which she and her lover will last until infinity. This feeling of a timeless romance is echoed in the previous lyric:

I only mention it ‘cause I’m ready to leave LA
And I need you to come (And I want you to come)
I guess I could manage if you stay
It’s just if you do, I can’t see myself having any fun, so

This bridge ties in a sense of remembrance and lustful nostalgia similar to that in Del Rey’s 2019 song “The greatest,” which opens with Del Rey yearning to relive the moments she spent with her lover:

I miss Long Beach and I miss you, babe
I miss dancing with you the most of all
I miss the bar where the Beach Boys would go']])]

[('So I’ll keep on moving

 And I hate the man that I’ve turned into

The line is about realising that, and then promising himself that he was gonna make it through to the other side.']])]

name: London's Requiem
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
As I look out upon my city, so bright and so pretty
Under this black London sky
And get lost in this maze of concrete and stone
Tales of sex, drugs and romance and victims of bad chance
The kids who live and die by the knife
So many lives lost but so few stories are told
From the tramps on the pavements with a ten-year engagement
To a needle and a bottle of wine
No kind words spoken, but to die alone and broken
Is the fate of the poor
‘Cause the drugs are a hеaler, on every cornеr a dealer
Prescribing his medicine so fine
But his patients will suffer a fate that no doctor could cure

[Chorus]
Oh, no, have you heard the news today?
They say London's burning down once again
And from the streets, you hear the people sing
From the streets, you hear the London requiem

[Verse 2]
As the sirens of the night play out the London lullaby
A sound that sends a chill down your spine
A sound that echoes through this artificial ghetto we call London town
‘Cause the armies of the street, they march for victory, not defeat
And though their mothers told them never to play with knives
Another solider of sixteen, no older, will fall to the ground
But still the sirens carry on long after his body is dead and gone
And will ring through these streets forevermore
He won't be the only boy to die lonely on the cold London stone
Other sisters and brothers, other fathers and mothers
Will wait for a knock upon their door
Their poor young solder of sixteen, no older, did not make it home

[Chorus]
Oh, no, have you heard the news today?
They say London's burning down once again
And from the streets, you hear the people sing
From the streets, you hear the London requiem

[Bridge]
But that's just the everyday
Nothing seems to change
All that we know
Is the bills get paid
So we can stay in this shit hole

[Chorus]
Oh, no, have you heard the news today?
They say London's burning down once again
And from the streets, you hear the people sing
From the streets, you hear the London requiem

name: Cool Girl
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I carry the time we don't talk in a backpack
Leave it on the side with the nights you didn't call me back
And all the ideas, and the hope I'd never ask him for
I'll throw them away, it's okay, without a second thought

[Pre-Chorus]
God, I swore I wouldn't play the age-old game
Yeah, I watched you all ask all your lovers away
Rollin' your eyes, to the backs of your heads
Surely you know to close them instead

[Chorus]
Cool girl will be different
I'll be quiet, oh so easy
Cool girl will be different
I'll be quiet, oh so easy

[Verse 2]
How much of a tongue can I bite until we notice blood?
Spit to the left, carry on, just smile and say you're good
You all plead and demand all your needs, but you can't
He'll be asked till he's bored, I would know, I've been bored before
Chill out if it's late or every heavy sigh will seal a fate

[Pre-Chorus]
God, I swore I wouldn't play the age-old game
Yeah, I watched you all ask all your lovers away
Rollin' your eyes, to the backs of your heads
Surely you know to close them instead

[Chorus]
Cool girl will be different
I'll be quiet, I'll be easy
Cool girl will be different
I'll be quiet, I'll be easy

[Outro]
(No, I won't be like them)
Cool girl will be different
I'll be quiet, I'll be easy
(Want me more than friend)
Cool girl, I'll be different
I'll be quiet, I'll be easy
(No, I won't be like them)
Cool girl, I'll be different
I'll be quiet, I'll be easy
(I'll be quiet again)
I'll be easy
Oh, so easy
annotations:
[('I’ll be quiet', [['When Dodie says “quiet” she means that she won’t cause a fuss by asking for her needs to be met. Earlier in the song, she details things she might need or want from this relationship that she’s not getting. “The times we don’t talk” and “you don’t call me back” refers to the fact that she’s not getting the attention she needs. But, even after realising these needs she has aren’t being met, she resolves to be “quiet.”']]), ('I’ll be easy', [['This line leaves us wondering if she means easy going. Which does fit with the theme ‘chill out’ of ‘Cool Girl’. But we worry if it could also be a bit darker, in that she’ll be “easy” (to bed) and hopes that will appeal to her partner.']]), ('God, I swore I wouldn’t play the age-old game', [['Here Dodie mentions how she promised herself that she wouldn’t get caught up in the drama and trauma of an unsupportive or abusive relationship. She was searching for something real while attempting to avoid the tiring dance or “game” of dating and the excessive emotional exertion that comes with it. But now finds herself in one of the exact positions she swore to avoid.']]), ('I’ll be quiet, I’ll be easy
 (Want me more than friend)', [['The chorus, which initially seemed like her proclamation of strength, gradually unmasked her underlying sentiment, which is desperation.

The chorus is repeated here but indicates a different tone. The first parts simply say “I’ll be quiet, oh so easy”, denoting strength. That she believes being cool and casual about things is what should be done and that it is not a problem for her.

As this expression repeats throughout, it gradually changes and reveals a more troubling sentiment which is desperation. As she repeats “I’ll be quiet” and reinforces “I’ll be easy” and follows with “(want me more than a friend)” it seems as though she’s begging the other person to want her because she made herself not be like the others despite the toll on her.']]), ('I’ll be quiet', [['dodie’s narrative voice is preoccupied with the discussion of broken promises of the past and the redundant desire to make them again. From ‘you didn’t call me back’ to ‘I’ll be different’ the narrative voice is splintered between past and future, thematically reminiscent of ‘When.’

Ironically the promise to change is encased in the most repetitive structure of the song. This suggests either misplaced determination or genuine change that is never valued, leaving the speaker to constantly become quieter and more disenfranchised from her original self with no payoff. The music video visually echoes this idea with dodie starting and finishing in the same position, alluding to a cycle of promising to change, therefore making change the true norm. The speaker must prioritise their own present needs to break the otherwise inevitable cycle of failure and self induced pathos.

I commented these ideas on the music video and dodie replied with ‘oh damn i didn’t even notice this tbh but ur so right’']]), ('And all the ideas, and the hope I’d never ask him for', [['Cool Girl serves as the first release to the album because it exemplifies the theme of building a problem. The conflict isn’t derived from an exogenous hubris (the arrogance of the love interest) or even Lasegue and Falret’s ‘folie a deux’ (a shared madness). The pathos is generated through the narrator’s pathology alone. The song explores how some of the most devastating psychological torment can be created, perpetuated and indulged in by the self.

Chronologically dodie is growing as an artist by beginning to reflect on internal contributing causes of suffering rather than on external experiences such as in ‘Boys like you’ or ‘Guiltless’']]), ('Yeah, I watched you all ask all your lovers away', [['She wrongly assumes that the reason relationships fail, is because by making your needs and wants heard and respecting your boundaries, you will push your partner away. By asking for the bare minimum that she needs, she feels she risks asking too much of her partner, so she ignores her needs.']]), ('Yeah, I watched you all ask all your lovers away', [['She wrongly assumes that the reason relationships fail, is because by making your needs and wants heard and respecting your boundaries, you will push your partner away. By asking for the bare minimum that she needs, she feels she risks asking too much of her partner, so she ignores her needs.']]), ('I’ve been bored before', [['Perhaps this is a sneaky little reference to the pandemic. The demo for Cool Girl was released on April 10th, about a month into when social distancing orders were put in place. We’re all bored out of our minds stuck in our houses, and Dodie may have wanted to acknowledge that.']]), ('Spit to the left, carry on, just smile and say you’re good', [['Dodie describes being a ‘cool girl’ throughout the song. This is basically a girl who is ‘different/better’ than ‘other girls’.

Dodie pretends she’s fine with everything and bites her tongue, while in reality, it bothers her. Still, she pretends it doesn’t and she doesn’t say anything, since that’s what a ‘cool girl’ would do. Otherwise, people would say she’s complaining, but this way she’s an easygoing, cool girl.

“spit to the left” is a direct reference to the previous line of biting (her) tongue until it bleeds. Spitting to the left is spitting that blood out before smiling and carrying on despite her being hurt.']])]

name: Runaway
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I was listening to the ocean
I saw a face in the sand
But when I picked it up
Then it vanished away from my hands, gone
I had a dream I was seven
Climbing my way in a tree
I saw a piece of heaven
Waiting in patience for me, down

[Pre-Chorus]
And I was running far away
Would I run off the world someday?
Nobody knows, nobody knows
And I was dancing in the rain
I felt alive and I can't complain

[Chorus]
But now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I can't take it anymore

[Verse 2]
I was painting a picture
The picture was a painting of you
And for a moment I thought you were here
But then again, it wasn't true, gone
And all this time I have been lying
Oh, lying in secret to myself
I've been putting sorrow on the farthest place on my shelf
La-di-da

[Pre-Chorus]
And I was running far away
Would I run off the world someday?
Nobody knows, nobody knows
And I was dancing in the rain
I felt alive and I can't complain

[Chorus]
But now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I got no other place to go
Now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I got no other place to go
Now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I can't take it anymore

[Bridge]
But I kept running for a soft place to fall
And I kept running for a soft place to fall
And I kept running for a soft place to fall
And I kept running for a soft place to fall

[Pre-Chorus]
And I was running far away
Would I run off the world someday?

[Chorus]
But now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I got no other place to go
Now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I got no other place to go

[Outro]
Now take me home, home where I belong, now, now
Now take me home, home where I belong, oh, oh
Now take me home, home where I belong, now, now
Now take me home, home where I belong
I can't take it anymore
annotations:
[('I got no other place to go', [['When all is said and done, Aurora reconciles with the fact that she will always be a product of where she comes from. Home is often inescapable, in that much of one’s sense of being is rooted in the conceptualization of ‘home’; in this case she is acknowledging that she does not have the means to be anywhere but home.']]), ('But now take me home
 Take me home where I belong
 I got no other place to go
 Now take me home
 Take me home where I belong
 I got no other place to go
 Now take me home
 Take me home where I belong', [['Many of Aurora’s songs deal with the idea that with Home – wherever and whatever that might be – comes peace, sanctuary and a sense of belonging.

Indeed, see her songs “Home”, “Awakening” and her unreleased songs “All My Demons”.

The repetition used in these lines reinforces to listeners that Aurora desperately wants to go home: the place where she feels safe and secure.']]), ('I saw a piece of heaven
 Waiting in patience for me, down', [["“Seeing heaven” implies that Aurora was close to death. Aurora personifies death, claiming it was “impatient” for her presence, when perhaps she longed for it instead. Feeling the allure of death is sometimes known as “l'appel du vide” (“the call of the void”).

Perhaps Aurora’s near-death experience is literal—in “Lucky,” she sings:

Not anybody knows that I am lucky to be alive"]]), ('I can’t take it anymore', [['Being away from home – all the people and places she loves – is unbearable… Aurora presents a paradox, as she wishes to run both away from home and towards it.']]), ('Nobody knows, nobody knows', [['Nobody knows what’s bothering her – this is something that Aurora must face herself.']]), ('I was painting a picture
 The picture was a painting of you
 And for a moment I thought you were here
 But then again, it wasn’t true, gone', [['When she was all alone, all her thoughts were focused on this special person.

Compare her song “Winter Bird”, where she paints a picture on the frozen glass of her window. It seems the thoughts in Aurora’s mind must be released – either through song or through art.']]), ('But now take me home
 Take me home where I belong', [['Home is usually associated with security and warmth. This is our place where everything starts and stops.

It’s a place where we can escape and think + enjoy ourselves.']]), ('I had a dream I was seven
 Climbing my way in a tree', [['She recalls being 7 years old – a time when, for most, life is easy, optimistic, and free of conflict.

The dream of climbing a tree could mean that she is subconsciously trying to reach a spiritual realisation; this is supported by the next line.']]), ('And all this time I have been lying
 Oh, lying in secret to myself
 I’ve been putting sorrow on the farthest place on my shelf
 La-di-da', [['In an interview with FaceCulture, Aurora said these lines are about convincing yourself that you’re not sad when you should be confronting your emotions:

That’s what you do when you’re sad but you pretend that you’re not, and you do everything you can to forget that you’re sad. But the thing you really need to do is to think about it until you understand it, and then it will be fine again. But that’s kind’ve what I mean with that line, that I’ve been lying to myself and that’s why I can’t move on—because I’m not facing it.']]), ('And I was dancing in the rain
 I felt alive and I can’t complain', [["Continuing the theme of escapism, the narrator takes a child-like or primal joy dancing in the rain without any care for her problems or situation.

This may be a loose reference to the 1952 American film Singin' in the Rain, in which actor Gene Kelly sings and dances with an umbrella in torrential rain."]])]

name: My Mistakes
lyrics:
The Mabbot street entrance of nighttown, before which stretches an uncobbled transiding set with skeleton tracks, red and green will-o'-the-wisps and danger signals. Rows of flimsy houses with gaping doors. Rare lamps with faint rainbow fans. Round Rabaiotti's halted ice gondola stunted men and women squabble. They grab wafers between which are wedged lumps of coal and copper snow. Sucking, they scatter slowly. Children. The swancomb of the gondola, highreared, forges on through the murk, white and blue under a lighthouse. Whistles call and answer.

THE CALLS Wait, my love, and I'll be with you.


THE ANSWERS Round behind the stable.

(A deaf mute idiot with goggle eyes, his shapeless mouth dribbling, jerks past, shaken in Saint Vitus' dance. A chain of children's hands imprisons him.)

THE CHILDREN Kithoguel Salute.

THE IDIOT (Lifts a palsied left arm and gurgles.) Grhahute!

THE CHILDREN Where's the great light?

THE IDIOT (Gobbing.) Ghaghahest.

(They release him. He jerks on. A pygmy woman swings on a rope slung between the railings, counting. A form sprawled against a dustbin and muffled by its arm and hat moves, groans, grinding growling teeth, and snores again. On a step a gnome totting among a rubbish tip crouches to shoulder a sack of rags and bones. A crone standing by with a smoky oil lamp rams the last bottle in the maw of his sack. He heaves his booty, tugs askew his peaked cap and hobbles off mutely. The crone makes back for her lair swaying her lamp. A bandy child, asquat on the doorstep with a papershuttlecock, crawls sidling after her in spurts, clutches her skirt, scrambles up. A drunken navvy ups with both hands the railings of an area, lurching heavily. At a corner two night watch in shoulder capes, their hands upon their staffholsters, loom tall. A plate crashes; a woman screams; a child wails. Oaths of a man roar, mutter, cease. Figures wander, lurk, peer from warrens. In a room lit by a candle stuck in a bottleneck a slut combs out the tatts from the hair of a scrofulous child. Cissy Caffrey's voice, still young, sings shrill from a lane.)

CISSY CAFFREY



I gave it to Molly
Because she was jolly,
The leg of the duck
The leg of the duck.


(Private Cart and Private Compton, swaggersticks tight in their oxters, as they march unsteadily rightaboutface and burst together from their mouths a volleyed fart. Laughter of men from the lane. A hoarse virago retorts.)

THE VIRAGO Signs on you, hairy arse. More power the Cavan girl.

CISSY CAFFREY More luck to me. Cavan, Cootehill and Belturbet.

(She sings.)

I gave it to Nelly
To stick in her belly
The leg of the duck
The leg of the duck.


(Private Cart and Private Compton turn and counterretort, their tunics bloodbright in a lampglow, black sockets of caps on their blond copper polls. Stephen Dedalus and Lynch pass through the crowd close to the redcoats.)

PRIVATE COMPTON (Jerks his finger.) Way for the parson.

PRIVATE CARR (Turns and calls.) What ho, parson!

CISSY CAFFREY (Her voice soaring higher.)

She has it, she got it,
Wherever she put it
The leg of the duck.


(Stephen, flourishing the ashplant in his left hand, chants with joy the introit for paschal time. Lynch, his jockey cap low on his brow, attends him, a sneer of discontent wrinkling his face.)

STEPHEN Vidi aquam egredientem de templo a latere dextro. Alleluia.

(The famished snaggletusks of an elderly bawd protrude from a doorway.)

THE BAWD (Her voice whispering huskily.) Sst! Come here till I tell you. Maidenhead inside. Sst.

STEPHEN (Altius aliqantulum) Et omnes ad quos pervenit acqua ista.

THE BAWD (Spits in their trail her jet of venom.) Trinity medicals. Fallopian tube. All prick and no pence.

(Edy Boardman, sniffling, crouched with Bertha Supple, draws her shawl across her nostrils.)

EDY BOARDMAN (Bickering.) And say the one: I seen you up Faithful place with your squarepusher, the greaser off the railway, in his cometobed hat. Did you, says I. That's not for you to say, says I. You never seen me in the mantrap with a married highlander, says I. The likes of her! Stag that one is. Stubborn as a mule! And her walking with two fellows the one time, Kildbride the enginedriver and lancecorporal Oliphant.

STEPHEN (Triumphaliter.) Salvi facti i sunt.

(He flourishes his ashplant shivering the lamp image, shattering light over the world. A liver and white spaniel on the prowl slinks after him, growling. Lynch scar's it with a kick.)

LYNCH So that?

STEPHEN (Looks behind.) So that gesture, not music, not odours, would be a universal language, the gift of tongues rendering visible not the lay sense but the first entelechy, the structural rhythm.

LYNCH Pornosophical philotheology. Metaphysics in Mecklenburg street!

STEPHEN We have shrewridden Shakespeare and henpecked Socrates. Even the allwisest stagyrite was bitted, bridled and mounted by a light of love.

LYNCH Ba!

STEPHEN Anyway, who wants two gestures to illustrate a loaf and a jug? This movement illustrates the loaf and jug of bread and wine in Omar. Hold my stick.

LYNCH Damn your yellow stick. Where are we going?

STEPHEN Lecherous lynx, to la belle dame sans merci, Georgina Johnson, ad deam qui laetificat juventutem meam.

(Stephen thrusts the ashplant on him and slowly holds out his hands, his head going back till both hands are a span from his breast, down turned in planes intersecting, the fingers about to part, the left being higher.)

LYNCH Which is the jug of bread? It skills not. That or the customhouse. Illustrate thou. Here take your crutch and walk.

(They pass. Tommy Caffrey scrambles to a gaslamp and, clasping, climbs in spasms. From the top spur he slides down. Jacky Caffrey clasps to climb. The navvy lurches against the lamp. The twins scuttle off in the dark. The navvy, swaying, presses a forefinger against a wing of his nose and ejects from the farther nostril a long liquid jet of snot. Shouldering the lamp he staggers away through the crowd with his flaring cresset.

Snakes of river fog creep slowly. From drains, clefts, cesspools, middens arise on all sides stagnant fumes. A glow leaps in the south beyond the seaward reaches of the river. The navvy staggering forward cleaves the crowd and lurches towards the tramsiding. On the farther side under the railway bridge Bloom appears flushed, panting, cramming bread and chocolate into a side pocket. From Gillens hairdressers window a composite portrait shows him gallant Nelson's image. A concave mirror at the side presents to him lovelorn longlost lugubru Booloohoom. Grave Gladstone sees him level Bloom for Bloom. He passes, struck by the stare of truculent Wellington but in the con vex mirror grin unstruck the bonham eyes and fatchuck cheekchops of Jollypoldy the rixdix doldy.

At Antonio Babaiotti's door Bloom halts, sweated under the bright arclamps. He disappears. In a moment he reappears and hurries on.)

BLOOM Fish and taters. N. g. Ah!

(He disappears into Olhousen's, the pork butcher's, under the downcoming rollshutter. A few moments later he emerges from under the shutter puffing Poldy, blowing Bloohoom. In each hand he holds a parcel, one containing a lukewarm pig's crubeen, the other a cold sheep's trotter sprinkled with wholepepper He gasps, standing upright. Then bending to one side he presses a parcel against his rib and groans.)

BLOOM Stitch in my side. Why did I run?

(He takes breath with care and goes forward slowly towards the lampset siding. The glow leaps again.)

BLOOM What is that? A flasher? Searchlight.

(He stands at Cormack's corner watching.)

BLOOM Aurora borealis or a steel foundry? Ah, the brigade, of course. South side anyhow. Big blaze. Might be his house. Beggar's bush. We're safe. (He hums cheerfully.) London's burning, London's burning! On fire, on fire! (He catches sight of the navvy lurching through the crowd at the farther side of Talbot street.) I'll miss him. Run. Quick. Better cross here.

(He darts to cross the road. Urchins shout.)

THE URCHINS Mind out, mister! (Two cyclists, with lighted paper lanterns aswing, swim by him, grazing him, their bells rattling.)

THE BELLS Haltyaltyaltyall.

BLOOM (Halts erect stung by a spasm.) Ow.

(He looks round, darts forward suddenly. Through rising fog a dragon sandstrewer, travelling at caution, slews heavily down upon him, its huge red headlight winking, its trolley hissing on the wire. The motorman bangs his footgong.)

THE GONG Bang Bang Bla Bak Blud Bugg Bloo.

(The brake cracks violently. Bloom, raising a policeman's whitegloved hand, blunders stifflegged, out of the track. The motorman thrown forward, pugnosed, on the guidewheel, yells as he slides past over chains and keys.)

THE MOTORMAN Hey, shitbreeches, are you doing the hattrick?

BLOOM (Bloom trickleaps to the curbstone and halts again. He brushes a mudflake from his cheek with a parcelled hand.) No thoroughfare. Close shave that but cured the stitch. Must take up Sandow's exercises again. On the hands down. Insure against street accident too. The Providential. (He feels his trouser pocket.) Poor mamma's panacea. Heel easily catch in tracks or bootlace in a cog. Day the wheel of the black Maria peeled off my shoe at Leonard's corner. Third time is the charm. Shoe trick. Insolent driver. I ought to report him. Tension makes them nervous. Might be the fellow balked me this morning with that horsey woman. Same style of beauty. Quick of him all the same. The stiff walk. True word spoken in jest. That awful cramp in Lad lane. Something poisonous I ate. Emblem of luck. Why? Probably lost cattle. Mark of the beast. (He closes his eyes an instant.) Bit light in the head. Monthly or effect of the other. Brainfogfag. That tired feeling. Too much for me now. Ow!

(A sinister figure leans on plaited legs against O'Beirnes wall, a visage unknown, injected with dark mercury. From under a wideleaved sombrero the figure regards him with evil eye.)

BLOOM Buenos noches, señorita Blanca, que calle es esta?

THE FIGURE (Impassive, raises a signal arm.) Password. Sraid Mabbot.

BLOOM Haha. Merci. Esperanto. Slan leath. (He mutters.) Gaelic league spy, sent by that fireeater.

(He steps forward. A sackshouldered ragman bars his path. He steps left, ragsackman left.)

BLOOM I beg. (He swerves, sidles, stepsaside, slips past and on.)

BLOOM Keep to the right, right, right. If there is a fingerpost planted by the Touring Club at Stepaside who procured that public boon? I who lost my way and contributed to the columns of the Irish Cyclist the letter headed, In darkest Stepaside. Keep, keep, keep to the right. Rags and bones, at midnight. A fence more likely. First place murderer makes for. Wash off his sins of the world.

(Jacky Caffrey, hunted by Tommy Caffrey, runs full tilt against Bloom.)

BLOOM O!

(Shocked, on weak hams, he halts. Tommy and Jacky vanish there, there. Bloom pats with parcelled hands watch, fobpocket, bookpocket, pursepocket, sweets of sin, potato soap.)

BLOOM Beware of pickpockets. Old thieves' dodge. Collide. Then snatch your purse.

(The retriever approaches sniffling, nose to the ground. A sprawled form sneezes. A stooped bearded figure appears garbed in the long caftan of an elder in Zion and a smoking cap with magenta tassels. Horned spectacles hang down at the wings of the nose. Yellow poison streaks are on the drawn face.)

RUDOLPH Second halfcrown waste money today. I told you not go with drunken goy ever. So. You catch no money.

BLOOM (Hides the crubeen and trotter behind his back and, crestfallen, feels warm and cold feetmeat) Ja, ich weiss, papachi.

RUDOLPH What you making down this place? Have you no soul? (With feeble vulture talons he feels the silent face of Bloom) Are you not my son Leopold, the grandson of Leopold? Are you not my dear son Leopold who left the house of his father and left the god of his fathers Abraham and Jacob?

BLOOM (With precaution.) I suppose so, father. Mosenthal. All that's left of him.

RUDOLPH (Severely.) One night they bring you home drunk as dog after spend your good money. What you call them running chaps?
